programme.desc: Amanda Machon meets with a different guest each episode who will show off their favorite spots in Albuquerque and the best way to experience this one-of-a-kind city. This series is all about discovering everything that makes ABQ unique and exciting.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Experience serious vacation vibes and discover some of the most special corners of America on this guided tour of must-visit cities.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Comedians, podcasters and craft beer enthusiasts Ed Bailey and Day Bracey explore hot spots, hidden gems and the best places to grab a cold brew in the 'Burgh.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each others signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponents creation.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Refugees Welcome: A Story of Immigration to Americas Heartland
programme.desc: Refugees Welcome documents how one Governors brave decision to welcome refugees during the Vietnam War had far reaching repercussions not only for the country but, generations later, for the fate of his own family.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: David suffered from a blood disorder and hasnt had a full set of teeth since he was 12. Heather struggles with a rare genetic condition that put her in dentures in her 20s. Can the FIXT team write the final chapter in their health journeys?

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: We explore how entrepreneurs reduce waste, enhance recycling and transform reused materials into unique goods. These efforts craft a sustainable tomorrow.

programme.title: Game On: Fight for the Kings
programme.desc: Game On: Fight for the Kings is a KCRA 3 documentary with never-before-heard stories of the four-month fight, the friendships garnered between the rival cities, and Sacramento doing the unimaginable: winning the battle for the Kings.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the citys unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: In this episode, we look at businesses that use their people, profits or platform to make a difference. Each having a unique quality about them: these businesses are on a mission.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Join WNBA player and Olympian Angel McCoughtry as she shows us the people and places that put Baltimore on the map. From sailing the Chesapeake, to sampling street foods, McCoughtry pulls back the curtain on what makes the Charm City so special.

programme.title: The Middle Child
programme.desc: In the 1980s, a serial killer buried a woman and three girls in the woods of New Hampshire. One of those girls is still unidentified. WMUR joins the investigators who promise they wont give up until her name is restored.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Local radio personality, Greg Adams, wants to shine a light on all parts of his beloved city and prove that Milwaukee has a lot more to offer than people might expect. In each episode, Greg is joined by a notable personality from the community who shows him their favorite spots and the best ways to experience them.

programme.title: Restaurants on the Radar
programme.desc: Brendan O'Connor has been tracking down and writing about hidden gem restaurants in Orlando for over a decade. Now you get to come along with him on a foodie tour of The City Beautiful to see what makes these places so special and a must try

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact travels to Chicago for an update on a scholarship program thats sending students and parents to college for free. Plus, an economic inequality expert discusses the impacts of long-term unemployment. And, a Holocaust survivor tells his story.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: In Free Spirit, award-winning bartender and host Kate Gerwin takes to the road and meets people in their workplaces and their favorite watering holes.

programme.title: Primarily Primates
programme.desc: In this episode we meet human's closest relatives - primates. See what makes a chimpanzee one of the most intelligent primates. Find out why the spider monkey is such an amazing climber and feel the power of the howler monkey's howl.

programme.title: Surf and Turf
programme.desc: In this episode we'll find out how sharks use electro-sensors to detect their prey. Also, discover the skunk's stinky defense mechanism. And domestic versus wild - see how the striped zebra matches up against its cousin the horse.

programme.title: Ecosystems
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits the Everglades of Florida and travels these waters by airboat to discover wildlife. Then we visit Yellowstone and explore this unique ecosystem that remains relatively undisturbed. We'll also look at planet Earth as one giant ecosystem, and examine the inter-dependency of all living things.

programme.title: Extreme Weather
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau ventures to Mt. Washington in New Hampshire, a place known as the "Home of the World's Worst Weather." We visit the "Wall of Wind" in Florida where scientists simulate hurricane force winds. In Colorado, we follow a scientific research team pursuing a tornado. We travel to Texas Tech, where they explore the destruction of debris thrown by tornadoes.

programme.title: South Dakota
programme.desc: Take a virtual Photowalk and tour through South Dakota.

programme.title: Nova Scotia
programme.desc: Take a virtual Photowalk and tour of the Canadian province with a Scottish and French touch.

programme.desc: In this episode we'll find out how sharks use electro-sensors to detect their prey. Also, discover the skunk's stinky defense mechanism. And domestic versus wild - see how the striped zebra matches up against its cousin the horse.

programme.title: Ecosystems
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits the Everglades of Florida and travels these waters by airboat to discover wildlife. Then we visit Yellowstone and explore this unique ecosystem that remains relatively undisturbed. We'll also look at planet Earth as one giant ecosystem, and examine the inter-dependency of all living things.

programme.title: Extreme Weather
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau ventures to Mt. Washington in New Hampshire, a place known as the "Home of the World's Worst Weather." We visit the "Wall of Wind" in Florida where scientists simulate hurricane force winds. In Colorado, we follow a scientific research team pursuing a tornado. We travel to Texas Tech, where they explore the destruction of debris thrown by tornadoes.

programme.title: South Dakota
programme.desc: Take a virtual Photowalk and tour through South Dakota.

programme.title: Nova Scotia
programme.desc: Take a virtual Photowalk and tour of the Canadian province with a Scottish and French touch.

programme.desc: In Boone County, Iowa, a man on a farm believes that he's shot himself but can't figure out how, and in Pryor, Oklahoma, an affair turns deadly resulting in a house fire.

programme.title: Operation Cat Walk: Strip Club Sting
programme.desc: FBI agent John Tanza goes undercover targeting the Cleveland mob the best way he can - by running a strip club that they call home. But rival factions place John squarely in the middle of the turf war, and an all-out battle nearly erupts at the club. John enlists a wanna-be security guard to snare everyone involved in the club's illegal operation. But will John's new best friend turn on him when he discovers John is FBI?
